content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the code snippet to solve your problem using Julia programming language. This function uses DataFrames.jl package, which enables dealing with data frames in Julia.

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [Date(i).year*100 + Date(i).month for i in df[:dt]]
    return df
end
```

In this function, `df` is your input DataFrame and `:dt` is the column of date-times. The new column `:ym` will be created with year-month concatenated as integers. 

Please note that you need to install and import the necessary packages (like DataFrames.jl) before running these codes in your Julia environment. You can do this by adding `using Pkg; Pkg.add("DataFrames"); using DataFrames` at the top of your script.
